title: Intro: cbsodata4
text: list datasets available can loaded cbs4_get_datasets() (cbs4_get_toc() alias) Using cbs4_search list tables can found contain desired search terms, e.g. “Diesel”: Using “Identifier” cbs4_get_datasets information table can retrieved cbs4_get_metadata meta object contains metadata properties cbsodata form data.frames. data.frame describes properties CBS table: “Dimensions”, “MeasureCodes” one ore “<Dimension>Codes” describing meta data borders SN table.
code: datasets <- cbs4_get_datasets() head(datasets[,c("Identifier", "Title", "Modified")]) datasets <- cbs4_search("Diesel") head(datasets[,c("Identifier", "Title", "rel")]) meta_petrol <- cbs4_get_metadata("80416ned") meta_petrol #> cbs odatav4: '80416ned': #> "Pompprijzen motorbrandstoffen; brandstofsoort, per dag" #> dimensions: Perioden #> For more info use 'str(x)' or 'names(x)' to find out its properties. names(meta_petrol) #> [1] "Dimensions"     "MeasureCodes"   "PeriodenGroups" "PeriodenCodes"  #> [5] "Properties" meta_petrol$MeasureCodes[, 1:3] meta_petrol$Dimensions # just 1 dimension with the following categories: head(meta_petrol$PeriodenCodes)

title: Intro: cbsodata4
text: cbs4_get_observations cbs4_get_data data can retrieved. default downloaded temporary directory, can set explicitly argument download_dir. cbs4_get_observations format data downloaded Statistic Netherlands (CBS). -called long format. contains one Measure column, describing topics/variable, one Value column describing statistical value, one Dimension columns extra columns value specific metadata. cbs4_get_data returns data -called wide format Measure column. many uses natural format. pivoted version cbs4_get_observations(). default names columns readable cbs4_get_data
code: obs <- cbs4_get_observations("80416ned") head(obs) # same data, but pivoted data <- cbs4_get_data("80416ned", name_measure_columns = FALSE) head(data, 2) # same data, but pivoted data <- cbs4_get_data("80416ned") head(data, 2)

title: Intro: cbsodata4
text: Dimension Measure columns use codes/keys/identifiers describe categories. can found metadata, can also automatically added using cbs4_add_label_columns.
code: obs <- cbs4_get_observations("80416ned") obs <- cbs4_add_label_columns(obs) head(obs) data <- cbs4_get_data("80416ned") data <- cbs4_add_label_columns(data) head(data, 2)

title: Intro: cbsodata4
text: period/time columns Statistics Netherlands (CBS) contain coded time periods: e.g. 2018JJ00 (.e. 2018), 2018KW03 (.e. 2018 Q3), 2016MM04 (.e. 2016 April). cbs4_add_date_column time periods converted added data:
code: obs <- cbs4_get_observations("80416ned") obs <- cbs4_add_date_column(obs) head(obs) data <- cbs4_get_data("80416ned") data <- cbs4_add_date_column(data) head(data)

title: Intro: cbsodata4
text: Measure measure unit, can added observations cbs4_add_unit_column()
code: obs <- cbs4_get_observations("80416ned") obs <- cbs4_add_unit_column(obs) head(obs)

title: Intro: cbsodata4
text: possible restrict download using filter statements. may shorten download time considerably.

title: Intro: cbsodata4
text: Filter statements columns can used restrict download. Note following: filter need use values found Identifier column cbs4_get_metadata objects. e.g. year 2020, code “2020JJ00”. filter values column add <column_name> = values cbs4_get_observations (cbs4_get_data) e.g. Perioden = c("2019KW04", "2020KW01") filter values column substring e.g. “JJ” can use <column_name> = contains(<substring>) cbs4_get_data e.g.  Perioden = contains("JJ") combine values substring use “|” operator: Periods = contains("2019") | "2020KW01"
code: meta <- cbs4_get_metadata("60006") tail(meta$PeriodenCodes) meta$MeasureCodes[,c("Identifier","Title")] obs <- cbs4_get_observations("60006"                             , Measure = c("M003026","M003019")     # selection on Measures                             , Perioden = c("2019KW04", "2020KW01") # selection on Perioden                             ) cbs4_add_label_columns(obs) data <- cbs4_get_data("60006"                      , Measure = c("M003026","M003019")     # selection on Measures                      , Perioden = contains("2019") # retrieve all periods with 2019                      ) data data <- cbs4_get_data("60006"                      , Measure = c("M003026","M003019")         # selection on Measures                      , Perioden = contains("2019") | "2020KW01" # retrieve all periods with 2019                      ) data

title: Intro: cbsodata4
text: adventurous, possible specify odata v4 query .
code: # supply your own odata 4 query   cbs4_get_data("84287NED", query = "$filter=Perioden eq '2019MM12'")

title: Intro: cbsodata4
text: Data metadata table can also downloaded explicitly using cbs4_download. can option don’t want load data memory (cbs4_get_data cbs4_get_observations ), store disk.
code: cbs4_download("60006", download_dir = "./60006") # will download data and metadata in csv format.

title: Intro: cbsodata4
text: CBS / Statistics Netherlands also offers collections datasets part main collections: -called catalogs. can retrieved cbs4_get_catalogs(). Another options set catalog argument cbs4_get_datasets NULL
code: catalogs <- cbs4_get_catalogs()  catalogs[,1:2] ds <- cbs4_get_datasets() nrow(ds) #> [1] 1620  ds_all <- cbs4_get_datasets(catalog = NULL) nrow(ds_all) #> [1] 1623  ds_asd <- cbs4_get_datasets(catalog = "CBS-asd") nrow(ds_asd) #> [1] 3

title: Authors and Citation
text: Edwin de Jonge. Author, maintainer. Han Oostdijk. Contributor.

title: Authors and Citation
text: de Jonge E (2022). cbsodata4: Statistics Netherlands (CBS) Open Data API Client v4. R package version 0.9.3.9000, https://github.com/statistiekcbs/cbsodata4.
code: @Manual{,   title = {cbsodata4: Statistics Netherlands (CBS) Open Data API Client v4},   author = {Edwin {de Jonge}},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.9.3.9000},   url = {https://github.com/statistiekcbs/cbsodata4}, }

what: Statistics Netherlands (CBS) Open Data API Client v4
title: Statistics Netherlands (CBS) Open Data API Client v4
text: goal cbsodata4 allowing access Open Data API v4 Statistics Netherlands. successor R package cbsodataR. uses new / efficient OData4 API download storage faster (using data.table) offers familiar wide data format users (cbs4_get_data) well default long format (cbs4_get_observations).

title: Statistics Netherlands (CBS) Open Data API Client v4
text: moment development version can installed GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("statistiekcbs/cbsodata4")

title: Statistics Netherlands (CBS) Open Data API Client v4
text: Retrieve list CBS / Statistics Netherlands tables cbs4_get_datasets: Get metadata table <Identifier> (e.g. 60006) cbs4_get_metadata: Retrieve data cbs4_get_data: cbs4_get_observations Add labels dataset cbs4_add_label_columns: Find non-standard CBS catalogs cbs4_get_catalogs: information see vignette("cbsodata4")
code: library(cbsodata4) # download the set of datasets datasets <- cbs4_get_datasets() datasets[1:5, c("Identifier", "Title")] meta <- cbs4_get_metadata(id="60006") print(meta) #> cbs odatav4: '60006': #> "Bouwnijverheid; productieve uren in de burgerlijke en utiliteitsbouw" #> dimensions: Perioden #> For more info use 'str(meta)' or 'names(meta)' to find out its properties. meta$Properties$Title #> [1] "Bouwnijverheid; productieve uren in de burgerlijke en utiliteitsbouw" # topics / measures meta$MeasureCodes[,c("Identifier", "Title")] # dimensions meta$Dimensions[, c("Identifier", "Title")] # wide format, each measure its own column data <- cbs4_get_data("60006") head(data[, 1:4]) # long format, one Value column obs <- cbs4_get_observations("60006") head(obs) data <- cbs4_add_label_columns(data) head(data[,1:5]) obs <- cbs4_add_label_columns(obs) head(obs) catalogs <- cbs4_get_catalogs() catalogs[,c("Identifier", "Title")]

what: Convert the time variable into either a date or numeric. — cbs4_add_date_column
title: Convert the time variable into either a date or numeric. — cbs4_add_date_column
text: Add extra date columns data set, creation time series graphics.

title: Convert the time variable into either a date or numeric. — cbs4_add_date_column
code: cbs4_add_date_column(data, date_type = c("Date", "numeric"), ...)

title: Convert the time variable into either a date or numeric. — cbs4_add_date_column
text: data data.frame retrieved using cbs4_get_data() date_type Type date column: "Date", "numeric". See details. ... future use.

title: Convert the time variable into either a date or numeric. — cbs4_add_date_column
text: original dataset two added columns: <period>_Date <period>_freq. See details.

title: Convert the time variable into either a date or numeric. — cbs4_add_date_column
text: Time periods data CBS coded: yyyyXXww (e.g. 2018JJ00, 2018MM10, 2018KW02), contains year (yyyy), type (XX) index (ww). cbs4_add_date_column converts codes Date() numeric. "Date" create date signifies start period: "2018JJ00" turn "2018-01-01" "2018KW02" turn "2018-04-01" "numeric" creates fractional number signs "middle" period. e.g. 2018JJ00 -> 2018.5 2018KW01 -> 2018.167. following reasons: otherwise 2018.0 mean 2018, 2018 Q1 2018 Jan, furthermore 2018.75 bit strange 2018 Q4. codes dataset frequency "Y" numeric output integer. <period_freq> column indicates period type / frequency: Y: year Q: quarter M: month W: week D: day

title: Convert the time variable into either a date or numeric. — cbs4_add_date_column
code: if (interactive()){    # works on observations...   obs <- cbs4_get_observations( id        = "80784ned"    # table id                               , Perioden  = "2019JJ00" # Year 2019                               , Geslacht  = "1100"       # code for total gender                               , RegioS    = "NL01"       # code for region NL                               , Measure   = "M003371_2"                               )    # add a Periods_Date column   obs_d <- cbs4_add_date_column(obs)   obs_d    # add a Periods_numeric column   obs_d <- cbs4_add_date_column(obs, date_type = "numeric")   obs_d    # works on data   d <- cbs4_get_data( id        = "80784ned"    # table id                     , Perioden  = "2019JJ00"   # Year 2019                     , Geslacht  = "1100"       # code for total gender                     , RegioS    = "NL01"       # code for region NL                     , Measure   = "M003371_2"                     )   cbs4_add_date_column(d) }

what: Add understandable labels to a table — cbs4_add_label_columns
title: Add understandable labels to a table — cbs4_add_label_columns
text: Add columns labels dataset.

title: Add understandable labels to a table — cbs4_add_label_columns
code: cbs4_add_label_columns(data, ...)

title: Add understandable labels to a table — cbs4_add_label_columns
text: data downloaded cbs4_get_data() ... used

title: Add understandable labels to a table — cbs4_add_label_columns
text: original dataset extra label columns. See details.

title: Add understandable labels to a table — cbs4_add_label_columns
text: cbs4_add_label_columns() adds Measure <Dimension> column extra column MeasureLabel ( <Dimension>Label) contains Title code, making table digestible. Title metadata can also found using cbs4_get_metadata().

title: Add understandable labels to a table — cbs4_add_label_columns
code: if (interactive()){   # works on observations   obs <- cbs4_get_observations("84287NED", Perioden="2019MM12")   obs # without label columns    obs_labeled <- cbs4_add_label_columns(obs)   obs_labeled    # works on data   d <- cbs4_get_data("84287NED", Perioden="2019MM12")   d # cbs4_get_data automagically labels measure columns.    d_labeled <- cbs4_add_label_columns(d)   d_labeled }

what: Add unit column to observations — cbs4_add_unit_column
title: Add unit column to observations — cbs4_add_unit_column
text: Add unit column  unit measure.

title: Add unit column to observations — cbs4_add_unit_column
code: cbs4_add_unit_column(data, ...)

title: Add unit column to observations — cbs4_add_unit_column
text: data downloaded cbs4_get_observations() ... used

title: Add unit column to observations — cbs4_add_unit_column
text: original observations data.frame() extra Unit column.

title: Add unit column to observations — cbs4_add_unit_column
text: cbs4_add_unit_column() retrieves Units Measure MeasureCodes metadata (cbs4_get_metadata()) adds observations data set.

title: Add unit column to observations — cbs4_add_unit_column
code: if (interactive()){   # works only on observations   obs <- cbs4_get_observations("84287NED", Perioden="2019MM12")   obs # without Unit column    obs_unit <- cbs4_add_unit_column(obs)   obs_unit # with unit column }

title: Download observations and metadata — cbs4_download
text: Download observations metadata directory. function working horse cbs4_get_data() cbs4_get_observations() many options. function useful want load entire dataset memory, just download data metadata csv format.

title: Download observations and metadata — cbs4_download
code: cbs4_download(   id,   download_dir = id,   ...,   query = NULL,   catalog = "CBS",   show_progress = interactive() && !verbose,   sep = ",",   verbose = getOption("cbsodata4.verbose", FALSE),   base_url = getOption("cbsodata4.base_url", BASEURL4) )

title: Download observations and metadata — cbs4_download
text: id Identifier publication download_dir directory files stored ... optional selection statement retrieve subset data. query optional odata4 query odata syntax (overwrites specification ...) catalog Catalog download show_progress logical TRUE downloading shows progress bar. used together verbose=TRUE sep seperator used writing data verbose messages printed... base_url Possible website implements protocol.

title: Download observations and metadata — cbs4_download
text: metadata table (invisible()).

what: Retrieve all (alternative) catalogs of Statistics Netherlands — cbs4_get_catalogs
title: Retrieve all (alternative) catalogs of Statistics Netherlands — cbs4_get_catalogs
text: Retrieve catalogs Statistics Netherlands. Beside main "CBS" catalog catalogs contain extra datasets part main production CBS / Statistics Netherlands.

title: Retrieve all (alternative) catalogs of Statistics Netherlands — cbs4_get_catalogs
code: cbs4_get_catalogs(   base_url = getOption("cbsodata4.base_url", BASEURL4),   verbose = getOption("cbsodata4.verbose", FALSE) )

title: Retrieve all (alternative) catalogs of Statistics Netherlands — cbs4_get_catalogs
text: base_url possible url implements interface verbose TRUE communication server shown.

title: Retrieve all (alternative) catalogs of Statistics Netherlands — cbs4_get_catalogs
text: data.frame() different catalogs available.

title: Get data from CBS — cbs4_get_data
text: Get data table id. data CBS opendata table -called wide format. Measure column.

title: Get data from CBS — cbs4_get_data
code: cbs4_get_data(   id,   catalog = "CBS",   ...,   query = NULL,   name_measure_columns = TRUE,   show_progress = interactive() && !verbose,   download_dir = file.path(tempdir(), id),   verbose = getOption("cbsodata4.verbose", FALSE),   sep = ",",   as.data.table = FALSE,   base_url = getOption("cbsodata4.base_url", BASEURL4) )

title: Get data from CBS — cbs4_get_data
text: id Identifier Opendata table. Can retrieved cbs4_get_datasets() catalog Catalog dataset found. ... optional selections data, passed cbs4_download. See examples query optional query odata4 syntax (overwrites specification ...) name_measure_columns logical TRUE Title measure set name column. show_progress TRUE shows progress data download, used together verbose. download_dir directory data metadata downloaded. default temporary directory, can set manually verbose TRUE prints steps taken retrieve data. sep separator used download data. .data.table logical, result type data.table? base_url Possible url implements protocol.

title: Get data from CBS — cbs4_get_data
text: data.frame() data.table() object. See details.

title: Get data from CBS — cbs4_get_data
text: returned data.frame() following columns: dimension separate column category identifiers. Category labels can added cbs4_add_label_columns() found cbs4_get_metadata(). Date columns can added cbs4_add_date_column(). Measure / Topic separate column values. Units can found cbs4_get_metadata() (MeasureCodes). long format instead wide format see cbs4_get_observations() one Measure column Value column.

title: Get data from CBS — cbs4_get_data
code: if (interactive()){    # filter on Perioden (see meta$PeriodenCodes)   cbs4_get_data("84287NED"                , Perioden = "2019MM12" # december 2019                )    # filter on multiple Perioden (see meta$PeriodenCodes)   cbs4_get_data("84287NED"                , Perioden = c("2019MM12", "2020MM01") # december 2019, january 2020                )    # to filter on a dimension just add the filter to the query    # filter on Perioden (see meta$PeriodenCodes)   cbs4_get_data("84287NED"                , Perioden = "2019MM12" # december 2019                , BedrijfstakkenBranchesSBI2008 = "T001081"                )     # filter on Perioden with contains   cbs4_get_data("84287NED"                 , Perioden = contains("2020")                 , BedrijfstakkenBranchesSBI2008 = "T001081"   )    # filter on Perioden with multiple contains   cbs4_get_data("84287NED"                 , Perioden = contains(c("2019MM1", "2020"))                 , BedrijfstakkenBranchesSBI2008 = "T001081"   )    # filter on Perioden with contains or = "2019MM12   cbs4_get_data("84287NED"                 , Perioden = contains("2020") | "2019MM12"                 , BedrijfstakkenBranchesSBI2008 = "T001081"   )    # This all works on observations too   cbs4_get_observations( id        = "80784ned"     # table id                        , Perioden  = "2019JJ00"     # Year 2019                        , Geslacht  = "1100"         # code for total gender                        , RegioS    = contains("PV") # provinces                        , Measure   = "M003371_2"    # topic selection                        )    # supply your own odata 4 query   cbs4_get_data("84287NED", query = "$filter=Perioden eq '2019MM12'")    # an odata 4 query will overrule other filter statements   cbs4_get_data("84287NED"                , Perioden = "2018MM12"                , query = "$filter=Perioden eq '2019MM12'"                )    # With query argument an odata4 expression with other (filter) functions can be used   cbs4_get_observations(     id     = "80784ned"    # table id     ,query = paste0(       # odata4 query        "$skip=4",          # skip the first 4 rows of the filtered result        "&$top=20",         # then slice the first 20 rows of the filtered result        "&$select=Measure,Geslacht,Perioden,RegioS,Value", # omit the Id and ValueAttribute fields        "&$filter=endswith(Measure,'_1')") # filter only Measure ending on '_1'     )  }

title: Get available datasets — cbs4_get_datasets
text: Get available datasets open data portal statline.

title: Get available datasets — cbs4_get_datasets
code: cbs4_get_datasets(   catalog = "CBS",   convert_dates = TRUE,   verbose = getOption("cbsodata4.verbose", FALSE),   base_url = getOption("cbsodata4.base_url", BASEURL4) )  cbs4_get_toc(   catalog = "CBS",   convert_dates = TRUE,   verbose = getOption("cbsodata4.verbose", FALSE),   base_url = getOption("cbsodata4.base_url", BASEURL4) )

title: Get available datasets — cbs4_get_datasets
text: catalog show datasets catalog. NULL datasets catalogs returned. convert_dates Converts date columns Date-Time type (stead character) verbose url request printed? base_url base url CBS OData 4 API

title: Get available datasets — cbs4_get_datasets
text: data.frame() publication metadata tables.

title: Get available datasets — cbs4_get_datasets
text: Setting catalog NULL return

title: Get available datasets — cbs4_get_datasets
text: datasets downloaded per R session cached. Subsequent calls cbs4_get_datasets use results first call.

title: Get available datasets — cbs4_get_datasets
code: if (interactive()){   # retrieve the main datasets (catalog = "CBS")   ds <- cbs4_get_datasets()   print(nrow(ds))    # see cbs4_get_catalogs() to retrieve all catalogs   ds_asd <- cbs4_get_datasets(catalog = "CBS-asd")   print(nrow(ds_asd))    ds_all <- cbs4_get_datasets(catalog = NULL)   print(nrow(ds_all)) }

what: Retrieve the metadata of a publication — cbs4_get_metadata
title: Retrieve the metadata of a publication — cbs4_get_metadata
text: Retrieve metadata publication. meta object contains metadata properties cbsodata form data.frames.

title: Retrieve the metadata of a publication — cbs4_get_metadata
code: cbs4_get_metadata(   id,   catalog = "CBS",   ...,   base_url = getOption("cbsodata4.base_url", BASEURL4),   verbose = getOption("cbsodata4.verbose", FALSE) )

title: Retrieve the metadata of a publication — cbs4_get_metadata
text: id Identifier publication data retrieved cbs4_get_data()/cbs4_get_observations() catalog Catalog, set cbs4_get_catalogs() ... used base_url alternative url implements interface statistics netherlands. verbose function report retrieving data

title: Retrieve the metadata of a publication — cbs4_get_metadata
text: data.frame describes properties CBS / Statistics Netherlands table: “Dimensions”, “MeasureCodes” one ore “\<Dimension\>Codes” describing meta data borders CBS table.

title: Retrieve the metadata of a publication — cbs4_get_metadata
code: if (interactive()){   meta <- cbs4_get_metadata("80416ned")   print(names(meta))    # Dimension columns in the dataset   meta$Dimensions    # the metadata of the Measures/Topics   meta$MeasureCodes    # the metadata of the Perioden Categories   meta$PeriodenCodes    # all descriptive and publication meta data on this dataset   meta$Properties }

what: Get observations from a table. — cbs4_get_observations
title: Get observations from a table. — cbs4_get_observations
text: Get observations table id. Observations data CBS opendata table -called long format.

title: Get observations from a table. — cbs4_get_observations
code: cbs4_get_observations(   id,   ...,   query = NULL,   catalog = "CBS",   download_dir = file.path(tempdir(), id),   show_progress = interactive() && !verbose,   verbose = getOption("cbsodata4.verbose", FALSE),   sep = ",",   includeId = TRUE,   as.data.table = FALSE,   base_url = getOption("cbsodata4.base_url", BASEURL4) )

title: Get observations from a table. — cbs4_get_observations
text: id Identifier Opendata table. Can retrieved cbs4_get_datasets() ... optional selections data, passed cbs4_download. See examples query optional query odata4 syntax (overwrites specification ...) catalog Catalog dataset found. download_dir directory data metadata downloaded. default temporary directory, can set manually show_progress TRUE shows progress data download, used together verbose. verbose TRUE prints steps taken retrieve data. sep separator used download data. includeId logical, Id column downloaded? .data.table logical, result type data.table? base_url Possible url implements protocol.

title: Get observations from a table. — cbs4_get_observations
text: data.frame() data.table() object, see details.

title: Get observations from a table. — cbs4_get_observations
text: returned data.frame() following columns: Measure column identifiers/codes measures/topics. Detailed information Measures can found MeasureCodes using cbs4_get_metadata(). Measure labels can added  cbs4_add_label_columns(). Value column (numerical) value, Units can added cbs4_add_unit_column(). optional ValueAttribute column data point specific metadata. dimension separate column category identifiers. Category labels can added cbs4_add_label_columns() found cbs4_get_metadata(). Date columns can added cbs4_add_date_column(). cbs4_get_data() offers alternative variable/topic/Measure column.

title: Get observations from a table. — cbs4_get_observations
code: if (interactive()){    # filter on Perioden (see meta$PeriodenCodes)   cbs4_get_data("84287NED"                , Perioden = "2019MM12" # december 2019                )    # filter on multiple Perioden (see meta$PeriodenCodes)   cbs4_get_data("84287NED"                , Perioden = c("2019MM12", "2020MM01") # december 2019, january 2020                )    # to filter on a dimension just add the filter to the query    # filter on Perioden (see meta$PeriodenCodes)   cbs4_get_data("84287NED"                , Perioden = "2019MM12" # december 2019                , BedrijfstakkenBranchesSBI2008 = "T001081"                )     # filter on Perioden with contains   cbs4_get_data("84287NED"                 , Perioden = contains("2020")                 , BedrijfstakkenBranchesSBI2008 = "T001081"   )    # filter on Perioden with multiple contains   cbs4_get_data("84287NED"                 , Perioden = contains(c("2019MM1", "2020"))                 , BedrijfstakkenBranchesSBI2008 = "T001081"   )    # filter on Perioden with contains or = "2019MM12   cbs4_get_data("84287NED"                 , Perioden = contains("2020") | "2019MM12"                 , BedrijfstakkenBranchesSBI2008 = "T001081"   )    # This all works on observations too   cbs4_get_observations( id        = "80784ned"     # table id                        , Perioden  = "2019JJ00"     # Year 2019                        , Geslacht  = "1100"         # code for total gender                        , RegioS    = contains("PV") # provinces                        , Measure   = "M003371_2"    # topic selection                        )    # supply your own odata 4 query   cbs4_get_data("84287NED", query = "$filter=Perioden eq '2019MM12'")    # an odata 4 query will overrule other filter statements   cbs4_get_data("84287NED"                , Perioden = "2018MM12"                , query = "$filter=Perioden eq '2019MM12'"                )    # With query argument an odata4 expression with other (filter) functions can be used   cbs4_get_observations(     id     = "80784ned"    # table id     ,query = paste0(       # odata4 query        "$skip=4",          # skip the first 4 rows of the filtered result        "&$top=20",         # then slice the first 20 rows of the filtered result        "&$select=Measure,Geslacht,Perioden,RegioS,Value", # omit the Id and ValueAttribute fields        "&$filter=endswith(Measure,'_1')") # filter only Measure ending on '_1'     )  }

what: Search table with search term — cbs4_search
title: Search table with search term — cbs4_search
text: Search opendata table using free text search.

title: Search table with search term — cbs4_search
code: cbs4_search(   query,   catalog = "CBS",   language = "nl-nl",   convert_dates = TRUE,   verbose = getOption("cbsodata4.verbose", FALSE),   base_url = getOption("cbsodata4.base_url", BASEURL4) )

title: Search table with search term — cbs4_search
text: query character text searched catalog show datasets catalog. NULL datasets catalogs returned. language character language catalog, currently Dutch convert_dates Converts date columns Date-Time type (stead character) verbose url request printed? base_url base url CBS OData 4 API

title: Search table with search term — cbs4_search
text: data.frame format cbs4_get_datasets() plus extra $rel column search score.

title: Search table with search term — cbs4_search
text: search engine currently searches odata3 data collection, uses Identifiers find tables odata4 data collection.

title: Search table with search term — cbs4_search
code: if (interactive()){    ds_nl <- cbs4_search("geboorte", language="nl-nl")   ds_nl[1:3, c("Identifier", "Title", "rel")]    bike_tables <- cbs4_search("fiets")   bike_tables[1:10, c("Identifier", "Title", "rel")] }

title: Detect substring in column — contains
text: Detects substring column filters dataset CBS: rows code contain (one ) x filtered .

title: Detect substring in column — contains
code: contains(x, column = NULL, allowed = NULL)  has_substring(x, column = NULL, allowed = NULL)

title: Detect substring in column — contains
text: x substring detected column column column name allowed character allowed values. supplied check x code allowed.

title: Detect substring in column — contains
code: if (interactive()){    # filter on Perioden (see meta$PeriodenCodes)   cbs4_get_data("84287NED"                , Perioden = "2019MM12" # december 2019                )    # filter on multiple Perioden (see meta$PeriodenCodes)   cbs4_get_data("84287NED"                , Perioden = c("2019MM12", "2020MM01") # december 2019, january 2020                )    # to filter on a dimension just add the filter to the query    # filter on Perioden (see meta$PeriodenCodes)   cbs4_get_data("84287NED"                , Perioden = "2019MM12" # december 2019                , BedrijfstakkenBranchesSBI2008 = "T001081"                )     # filter on Perioden with contains   cbs4_get_data("84287NED"                 , Perioden = contains("2020")                 , BedrijfstakkenBranchesSBI2008 = "T001081"   )    # filter on Perioden with multiple contains   cbs4_get_data("84287NED"                 , Perioden = contains(c("2019MM1", "2020"))                 , BedrijfstakkenBranchesSBI2008 = "T001081"   )    # filter on Perioden with contains or = "2019MM12   cbs4_get_data("84287NED"                 , Perioden = contains("2020") | "2019MM12"                 , BedrijfstakkenBranchesSBI2008 = "T001081"   )    # This all works on observations too   cbs4_get_observations( id        = "80784ned"     # table id                        , Perioden  = "2019JJ00"     # Year 2019                        , Geslacht  = "1100"         # code for total gender                        , RegioS    = contains("PV") # provinces                        , Measure   = "M003371_2"    # topic selection                        )    # supply your own odata 4 query   cbs4_get_data("84287NED", query = "$filter=Perioden eq '2019MM12'")    # an odata 4 query will overrule other filter statements   cbs4_get_data("84287NED"                , Perioden = "2018MM12"                , query = "$filter=Perioden eq '2019MM12'"                )    # With query argument an odata4 expression with other (filter) functions can be used   cbs4_get_observations(     id     = "80784ned"    # table id     ,query = paste0(       # odata4 query        "$skip=4",          # skip the first 4 rows of the filtered result        "&$top=20",         # then slice the first 20 rows of the filtered result        "&$select=Measure,Geslacht,Perioden,RegioS,Value", # omit the Id and ValueAttribute fields        "&$filter=endswith(Measure,'_1')") # filter only Measure ending on '_1'     )  }

title: cbsodata4 0.9.3
text: Added NEWS.md file track changes package. Updated odata4 url https://datasets.cbs.nl/odata
